title: Man crushed by pallet in Sydney warehouse
text:
A 26-year-old man has suffered spinal injuries after he was crushed by a falling pallet while unloading a shipping container at a warehouse in Sydney’s west.

The worker has been transported to Westmead Hospital after the accident in Seven Hills.

A spokesman for CareFlight said a helicopter was sent to the scene of the accident at 9:10am and landed seven minutes later in McCoy Park, metres away from the incident.

NSW Ambulance provided initial treatment for the man and CareFlight’s specialist doctor and critical care paramedic gave additional medical care for the patient who sustained suspected spinal injuries.

The patient was transported by road ambulance with CareFlight’s doctor to Westmead Hospital in a stable condition.

NSW Police were at the scene and a SafeWork Australia investigation is likely to begin later today.
description: A 26-year-old man has suffered spinal injuries after he was crushed by a falling pallet while unloading a shipping container at a warehouse in Sydney’s west.
